intro: Eriogonum piperi var. ochrocephalum, commonly known as the yellowhead buckwheat, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its yellowish-green leaves and showy, pale yellow to cream-colored flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family, which includes other familiar plants like sorrel and buckwheat. The species is known for its ecological importance, providing nectar for pollinators and habitat for various wildlife species.
